phase.name: The Core 'Uptime' Feature & Beacon Network
phase.description: Build the Beacon Network comparison tool that monitors provider health and correlates with user errors to provide intelligent alerts

architectureOverview: The Beacon Network is a comparison tool that provides StackDock's internal baseline for provider health. It helps distinguish between user-specific issues and global provider outages, enabling intelligent alert correlation. The UI is displayed as an in-app flyout/component (button that opens a sheet/modal), not a standalone page.
objectives: Deploy demo apps on major providers (AWS, Vercel, Cloudflare, DigitalOcean)
Create Cloudflare Worker with cron trigger to monitor demo apps
Build Convex backend to receive and aggregate beacon data
Implement correlation engine to match user errors with provider status
Create frontend UI component (flyout) to display Beacon Network status
deliverables: Demo apps deployed on all major providers with health endpoints
Cloudflare Worker with cron trigger monitoring demo apps
Convex HTTP Action to receive beacon data
Convex Scheduled Function to aggregate provider status
Frontend flyout component displaying Beacon Network status
risks: Deploying demo apps across multiple providers may be time-consuming
Cloudflare Worker cron configuration may need iteration
Correlation logic may require fine-tuning based on real data
Real-time updates may have performance implications
successCriteria: All demo apps are deployed and responding to health checks
Cloudflare Worker is pinging demo apps every 5 minutes
Convex backend is receiving and storing beacon data
Provider status is accurately tracked and queryable
Frontend displays real-time Beacon Network status
Error correlation works correctly (user-specific vs global outage)
